definition[0]: to make a wet surface become dry by pressing soft paper or cloth on it
definition[1]: a mark or dirty spot on something, especially made by ink
definition[2]: a building, structure etc that is ugly and spoils the appearance of a place
example[1]: The new power station is a blot on the landscape.
definition[3]: something that spoils the good opinion that people have of someone or something
example[2]: The increase in juvenile crime is a blot on our time.
